meanings.definition: Belief in or acceptance of something as true or genuine.
meanings.sent1: Her cred in the conspiracy theory was unwavering.
meanings.sent2: His story lacked cred among the group.
meanings.sent3: The talking cat really tested my cred.
meanings.sent4: His explanation for the missing cookies stretched my cred to the limit.
meanings.sent5: The magician's performance left a lasting impression on my cred.

meanings.definition: The quality of being convincing or believable.
meanings.sent1: The evidence provided strong cred to the argument.
meanings.sent2: The movie's plot lacked cred and left the audience confused.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a flying pig had some questionable cred.
meanings.sent4: Her smile added cred to her friendly demeanor.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's findings shook the very foundation of our cred in the theory.

meanings.definition: Reputation or influence based on past achievements or actions.
meanings.sent1: His street cred made him popular among the youth.
meanings.sent2: The author's cred in the literary world was well-established.
meanings.sent3: The cat's cred as a mouse catcher was put to the test.
meanings.sent4: Her cred as a leader inspired many to follow her.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's cred as a record-breaker was unmatched in the sport.
